Configuring Ctrl-P in Vi

03 Jul 2015

CtrlP.vim is a fuzzy path, file finder plugin for the Vim editor.
I recently spent some time digging into the configuration options for Ctrl-P to make it perform better on my work systems.

 1" ctrlp vim plug in override options
 2" use find for building file index instead of vim globbing (buggy in OSX)
 3let g:ctrlp_user_command = 'find %s -type f'
 4" increase the default max size of results
 5let g:ctrlp_match_window = 'max:35'
 6" enable cross session caching
 7let g:ctrlp_clear_cache_on_exit = 0
 8" max number fo files to scan
 9let g:ctrlp_max_files = 100000
10let g:ctrlp_max_depth = 100
11" default mode to open CtrlP in
12let g:ctrlp_cmd = 'CtrlPMixed'
